content.body: fwiw, node.js uses the test suite like how wpt is been tested in node.js: https://github.com/nodejs/node/tree/main/test/test426
Yah, that's essentially what I'm about to do with a git submodule because there's not a npm package
It'd be a little nicer if I could just `import {tests} from 'source-map-tests' with { type: 'json' }`
content.formatted_body: It'd be a little nicer if I could just import {tests} from 'source-map-tests' with { type: 'json' }

content.body: The biggest change would be making this useful to my codec package, which only understands `mappings` (and soon `scopes`) field and doesn't do anything with the larger map
content.formatted_body: The biggest change would be making this useful to my codec package, which only understands mappings (and soon scopes) field and doesn't do anything with the larger map

content.body: I want to have a golden Decoded Source Map Record with decoded `mappings`/`ranges`/`originalScope` fields set appropriately
content.formatted_body: I want to have a golden Decoded Source Map Record with decoded mappings/ranges/originalScope fields set appropriately

content.body: That'd allow me to test both decoding into the spec Record structure, and encoding from the Record into the string
